school.name: Fontys Venlo University of Applied Sciences

projects.title: Thesis:
FRC project: “The Soccer Robot”
projects.description:
Goals: The system consists in a machine that is able in a given environment to recognize a ball, follow it and catch it. The ball after has been charged is going to be kicked on a goal using camera vision. The system is able to work in autonomous mode and with the active intervention of a human operator. The robot is also controllable with gestures using Microsoft Kinect.
 
My position: 
Electrical Engineer, I looked after the hardware system architecture that has been used:
 - sensors, transducers and their implementation on the data acquiring platform.
 - ESC and actuators
 - power distribution and wiring. 
As a Telecommunications Engineer I looked after all the aspects about system network interface. 

Achievements: 
The robot satisfied all the tasks required and it has been exhibited at the International Humanoid and Service Robots Expo, Milan
 
Duration: 5 months
 Platform used: National Instruments CompactRIO-FRC I

projects.title: 3D printer (extruder)
projects.description:
Goal: Designing and realizing an extruder for a 3D printer 
My rule: program and control the step motor mounted over the extruder.
 Main Tasks:
 • Realize the calculation for the number of steps related to the melting temperature of the PLA wire
 • Choosing the right kind of Electrical Motor concerning the Power and Moment 
• Realize the code that have to be implement on arduino UNO also considering a sensor of temperature mounted over the extruder.

profile_positions.description:
- Manage and release of deliverables from D&E projects

profile_positions.title: Industrial Engineering Consulting

profile_positions.description:
The Supplier Quality Manager maintains and develops the relation to the supplier with the purpose to create an optimal engineering collaboration between supplier and ASML. Using personal skills, I work closely together with the supplier & ASML development teams to optimize the effectiveness and efficiency of the product generation process, in alignment with the ASML project plan. The main goal of this cross-sector activity is to secure an excellent quality of parts delivered by our Suppliers.

Responsibilities:
•	Coordinating role with respect to all SQE activities within the allocated project.
•	Early supplier involvement in the D&E project to secure that technology expertise of ASML and supplier are merged in the best way.
•	Ensure that not only parts quality, however, also manufacturability and serviceability aspects are covered in the design phase.
•	Document the D&E project collaboration, including supplier & ASML responsibilities and roles via a Statement of Work (SoW).
•	New product introduction (NPI) and supplier selection when applicable.
•	Deliverables that secure parts quality from suppliers in the ASML product generation process, such as:
o	Acceptance of the design and/or specification
o	Complete & detailed parts qualification process
o	Acceptance of qualified parts
o	Process flow and Process failure mode effect analysis
o	First article inspection
•	Define and maintain supplier interface processes, such as:
o	Issue resolution
o	Qualification deviation
o	Configuration & change management
o	ASML factory disturbances
•	Contribute to supplier development to improve operational excellence by driving execution of existing agreements, improvement actions, and participation in supplier audits.

The Supplier Quality Manager is part of the D&E project team and, therefore, interfaces with project leaders, design engineers, architects, manufacturing & customer support engineers, logistics, procurement, etc.
profile_positions.title: Supplier Quality Manager

profile_positions.description:
In the Start-up Equipment Support group, I support the roll out of the hardware/software upgrades on EUV lithography systems, involving frequent and long trips to the customer site. My field of focus is the Source vessel.
Main responsabilities:
- Leading or supporting the preparation of the upgrade packages and customer sites
- Coordination on site, including managing the sequence, handling technical issues and leading escalations
- Preventing issues from re-occurring by driving a structured issue resolution process

profile_positions.description:
APIL works with Italian-Libyan Authorities and Institutions, Private and Public Investors to promote the professional and business activities in Libya for more than 80 Italian Companies in the fields of Industries, Energy & Water Treatment, Constructions and Strategic Structures. 

My position: Web-platform maintaining using an assigned CMS.
 Keep the assigned informatics platform in perfect state by: 
 Keep the system configuration up to date
  Keep the web-platform contents up to date
  Keep the user list configured and up to date
  Keep the media sources configured and up to date
 Provide competency support in case of escalation by team members through proper documentations.
 Provide documentations and support during public events and activities organized and operated by APIL on exhibitions, conferences & events in Libya, by promoting, in these International Activities, Italian Authorities and Institutions, Private and Public Associations, Professional Associations, Major companies, associated and partners of the Association Project Italy Libya - APIL.
profile_positions.title: Web-maintenance Engineer

company.name: Project Leader for Team Leonardo, team of robotics

profile_positions.location: Robotics Lab  DII,faculty of engineering at Università Politecnica delle Marche
profile_positions.description:
Project Leader in a team of robotics comprised by 12 members in field of Mechanical Engineering, Computer Science, Administration and Management. Team Leonardo will be a rookie team for FIRST robotics competition on 2014. Team Leonardo is in collaboration with: the Laboratory of Artificial Intelligence and Real Time Systems mentored by Mr. Aldo Franco Dragoni; Chamber of Commerce of Fermo, G.M. Montani Institute of applied science and Team 122 NASA knights of Hampton, VA.
 

Goals:
 The system consists in a machine that is able in a given environment to climb over a metallic pyramid. The system is also able to recognize a disc through camera vision technology and pick it up from the floor. The disk after has been charged is going to be launched on a wall where some openings are placed in several positions. The system is able to work in autonomous mode and with the active intervention of a human operator. 

My position: 
Project Leader, I’m looking after the aspects related with:
 - Creation and execution project work plans and revises as appropriate to meet changing needs and requirements. 
- Managing day-to-day of operational aspects of the project and its scope. 
- Ensure that project documents are complete, current, and stored appropriately.
 - Identification of resources needed and assigns individual responsibilities.
 During the extra time I use to spend my time programming the microcontroller and studying the protocol for the system data transmission to improve aspects of remote control.

 Achievements: 
The project has completed the mechanical design and also the programming development, both of them have been tested through simulations that can make sure their implementation.
 
Platform used: ARDUINO UNO
profile_positions.title: Project Leader for Team Leonardo, team of robotics

profile_positions.description: Mentoring on Reconfigurable Control and Acquisition Systems Architectures, using National Instruments platforms. During one year I worked 6 months as a volunteer, and 6 months as an employee with a contract for 40hours per week.
